p: Alga biofuel has the potential to meet global demand since they do not compete with the production of food products. They can be exploited to biofuels inclusive of biodiesel, bioethanol/biobutanol, syngas, biochar, biogas and energy (electricity/heat) through various processing technologies such as thermochemical conversion (transesterification, thermochemical liquefaction, direct combustion, gasification and pyrolysis) and biochemical conversion (fermentation, anaerobic digestion and photobiological hydrogen production) ( Figure 6) [ 16, 188].
